Key Arguments: The government should not have the authority to dictate what is considered truth or to silence citizens.
Free speech is fundamental to a democratic society and essential for the exchange of diverse ideas.
The proposed legislation is seen as a threat to individual rights and freedoms.
The advancement of the Bill to the draft stage is concerning and suggests a weakening of democratic principles.
Notable Quotes: Central to the essence of a democratic ethos is the preservation of the freedom to express a spectrum of ideas and viewpoints.
The erosion of individual rights is incompatible with the principles that safeguard the vitality of our nation.
